captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight, featuring Trundle, the Troll King.
Armed with an enormous frozen club and his gruff, snarky wit, Trundle eagerly tramples anyone who questions his absolute troll authority.
Trundle is a melee tank fighter who can sap the strength of his enemies and use it to boost his power in battle.
With exceptional regeneration and the power to reshape the battleground, Trundle easily conquers the jungle and solo lanes.
When an enemy unit dies near Trundle, his passive, King’s Tribute, heals him for a percentage of their maximum health.
As an extra source of regeneration, this keeps Trundle surprisingly difficult to kill at all stages of the game.
Chomp resets Trundle’s attack cooldown and causes his next attack to deal bonus damage.
The bite saps the target’s attack damage and boosts Trundle’s attacks for a few seconds.
Chomp also slows the target very briefly, and is Trundle’s primary damage spell.
Frozen Domain gives Trundle an attack and movement speed boost in a large area for a few seconds.
While in his Frozen Domain, Trundle gains bonus healing and regeneration from all sources as well. This boosts the power of King’s Tribute significantly.
Pillar of Ice raises a terrain-blocking glacier from the earth, pushing aside all units, and slowing enemies around it.
Pillar of Ice can be used to block narrow paths and interrupt enemy channeled abilities if they’ve been displaced by the pillar.
Subjugate is Trundle’s ultimate. When cast on an enemy champion, he instantly drains a percentage of their maximum health, armor, and magic resist.
Over the next few seconds, Trundle drains that amount a second time, crippling the enemy’s defense and bolstering his own.
When starting in the jungle, Chomp is important for sapping damage from the toughest jungle monsters.
With its low cooldown, Chomp gives Trundle the extra damage he needs to clear camps quickly,
while King’s Tribute is passively granting him him extra sustain.
When going for a gank, Frozen Domain helps Trundle close the gap and get in range for a well-placed Pillar of Ice.
In this scenario, his pillar actually pushes Ashe against the wall, blocking her off from retreating toward her own turret.
Even with no walls nearby, Trundle’s typical gank opens with Frozen Domain into Pillar of Ice for the slow.
Chomp and a few basic attacks with the boosted damage are enough to grant him a kill.
In any skirmish, Subjugate is Trundle’s greatest tool for survival.
Getting caught out of position and exhausted, Trundle baits this fight, using Subjugate to leech Thresh’s health and resistances.
This allows him to survive long enough to land a Pillar of Ice and assist LeBlanc for the kill.
With its long cast range, Pillar of Ice can also be used to safely initiate on a teamfight, crippling opponents with the slow.
Here Trundle catches the team overextended, picking off Karthus and Taric, then leading a valiant charge at Garen who escapes with a sliver of health.
Pillar of Ice is also a great way to set up easily aimed skill shots for teammates.
By forcing Karma to run around the pillar, he sets up a grab for Blitzcrank where she otherwise would’ve escaped by running between the nexus turrets.
Trundle is a master at manipulating enemy movement, and is very difficult to pursue.
Using Frozen Domain to repeatedly give himself speed boosts, he uses Subjugate to leech health and survive heavy punishment from Cho'Gath, Sejuani, and Gragas.
Another Pillar of Ice slows their pursuit enough for him to speed away as Draven joins the futile chase into his Frozen Domain.
Subjugate often turns the tide of fights that appear to be in the enemy’s favor.
Using Frozen Domain to rush straight into the action, Trundle steals Baron for his team, then tanks a full channel of Malzahar’s ultimate.
He immediately casts Subjugate on Malzahar, leeching his health and keeping him distracted as his teammates take down the others.
In any teamfight, Pillar of Ice can split the enemy team up, singling out targets and hindering their movement.
As the red team pursues into Trundle’s jungle, he separates Sejuani, Cho'Gath and Thresh, leaving them almost unable to move for the rest of the fight.
Repeated Chomps and Frozen Domain, and subjugate help finish off the enemy team for a successful ace.
When building Trundle, focus on a mix of physical damage, health and resistances.
For runes, try Attack Damage Marks, Armor Seals, Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs, and Attack Damage Quintessences.
For Masteries, try 9/21/0, taking attack speed and armor penetration in Offense, along with health and resistances in Defense.
Flash and Smite are great choices on jungle Trundle, allowing him to chase down enemies and secure kills.
Thanks for tuning into the Trundle Champion Spotlight.
Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel and leave us your comments just below the video!

comments.author: jeffrey verhoef

comments.text:
+jeffrey verhoef gold is nothing special and you did ask if you should 
change anything. thornmail makes for a terrible first defensive item and 
sunfire cape should be bought early to maximise the magic damage as it does 
not scale. I would swap them around.

not that it really matters. having a 'build' is not a good idea. you cannot 
create a 6 item build that works for every game. botrk is a key item, but 
everything else is completely dependent on the game environment. the 
defensive items you buy should be a reaction to the offensive power of your 
opponents.
if you were facing a rumble in lane, thornmail would be a complete waste.
if the entire enemy team was ad champions, spirit visage would be wasted.
they are all good items for trundle, but not in every situation.

comments.author: Troyzgab123

comments.text:
So today I gave up on finding a champion that could do everything I needed, 
and decided to curve my champion selection back towards my element, Ice, 
because im just a defensive kind of person. I was trying to think of an 
ice-related champion for every role, and I came up with Fighter Trundle, 
APC Lissandra, ADC Ashe, Jungler/tank Sejuani, and Support/tank Braum. 
Having experience with every one of those champions other than Trundle, I 
whip up the spotlight, and find he's got everything I need! He's got no 
poke but chomp's damage theiving trait allows easy trading, while his 
passive is his sustain. His W isnt quite a dash ability like I prefer, but 
after watching a few of the spotlight escapes, I realize that movement 
speed buff is not to be under estimated! Thirdly, his not too mana reliant, 
because he's auto attack based for damage, and finally his ultimate gives 
me that undying feeling I love as a defensive kind of person. Found a new 
main I think!﻿
comments.author: Zentro705

comments.text:
Enchant you berserkers greaves with furor. You don't need a poke because 
you can isolate and rush an enemy. A lot of people don't even know what his 
E does, and since it looks scary bad team mates will often avoid the pillar 
rather than helping their friend. E, W, Q, R is ABSOLUTELY inescapable and 
result in 1v1 wins 98% of the time. His R makes people believe they can 
beat you, but there ain't a chance in hell.
